title: Citigroup Has Nearly $10 Billion in Total Russian Exposure
sub_head: Sanctions complicate Citigroup’s attempt to sell its Russian consumer bank
body:
Citigroup Inc. disclosed Monday it had nearly $10 billion in total exposures to Russia at the end of 2021, some of which sit in a consumer bank it has been trying to sell and may now be stuck with.
The New York giant, which bills itself as the world’s truly global bank, is by far the most exposed of the big U.S. banks to Russia in the midst of a global sanctioning regime that is threatening Russia’s economy after its invasion of Ukraine last week. Russia is, nonetheless, a small part of Citigroup’s $2.29 trillion in assets.
